item.title: What's new in pip 25.0
item.description: pip 25.0 adds support for SPDX License Expressions (PEP 639), build environment bugfixes, and further optimizations among other changes.

item.title: What's new in pip 24.3
item.description: pip 24.3 is a small release with a truststore bugfix, error QoL improvements, and one minor deprecation of noncompliant wheel filenames.

item.title: What's new in pip 24.2 â€” or why legacy editable installs are deprecated
item.description: In version 24.2, pip learns to use system certificates by default, receives a handful of optimizations, and deprecates legacy (setup.py develop) editable installations.

item.title: What's new in Black 23.1.0
item.description: Black 23.1.0 introduces an updated stable style, improved inference of the default target version(s), and other QOL improvements.

item.title: Black 23.1a1 - please help us test the 2023 stable style!
item.description: We just released Black 23.1a1 with the first draft of the 2023 stable style, please try it out and let us know your feedback and concerns.

item.title: What's new in Black 22.10.0
item.description: Black 22.10.0 removes runtime support for Python 3.6, fixes a major fmt: off/on bug, and other QOL improvements.

item.title: Compiling Black with mypyc, Pt. 3 - Deployment
item.description: mypyc can compile Black and provide respectable performance gains, let's deploy it in production!

item.title: Compiling Black with mypyc, Pt. 2 - Optimization
item.description: Compiling Black without errors or warnings was the easy bit, now I had to optimize it for mypyc.

item.title: Compiling Black with mypyc, Pt. 1 - Initial Steps
item.description: I spent a COVID summer (and then some) integrating mypyc into Black to double performance. How was it?

item.title: About me
item.description: Short version: I'm Richard aka ichard26 (he/they). I'm a hobby Python developer and FOSS contributor. I contribute to mypyc and pip and used to co-maintain Black and Bandersnatch. Staff at Python Discord.

item.title: Privacy Statement
item.description: TL;DR, I'm doing my best to not track you and respect your privacy as much as practically possible. All analytics are anonymized and follow GDPR, PECR and CCPA. Hosting is provided by GitHub Pages and DigitalOcean.
